title: Hackers abuse OAuth 2.0 workflows to hijack Microsoft 365 accounts
summary: Russian threat actors have been abusing legitimate OAuth 2.0 authentication workflows to hijack Microsoft 365 accounts of employees of organizations related to Ukraine and human rights. [...]

title: Lazarus hackers breach six companies in watering hole attacks
summary: In a recent espionage campaign, the infamous North Korean threat group Lazarus targeted multiple organizations in the software, IT, finance, and telecommunications sectors in South Korea. [...]

title: Microsoft fixes machine learning bug flagging Adobe emails as spam
summary: Microsoft says it mitigated a known issue in one of its machine learning (ML) models that mistakenly flagged Adobe emails in Exchange Online as spam. [...]

title: Frederick Health data breach impacts nearly 1 million patients
summary: ​A ransomware attack in January at Frederick Health Medical Group, a major healthcare provider in Maryland, has led to a data breach affecting nearly one million patients. [...]

title: Microsoft now pays up to $30,000 for some AI vulnerabilities
summary: Microsoft announced an increase in bug bounty payouts to $30,000 for AI vulnerabilities found in Dynamics 365 and Power Platform services and products. [...]

title: Interlock ransomware claims DaVita attack, leaks stolen data
summary: The Interlock ransomware gang has claimed the cyberattack on DaVita kidney dialysis firm and leaked data allegedly stolen from the organization. [...]

title: Yale New Haven Health data breach affects 5.5 million patients
summary: Yale New Haven Health (YNHHS) is warning that threat actors stole the personal data of 5.5 million patients in a cyberattack earlier this month. [...]

title: Lazarus Hits 6 South Korean Firms via Cross EX, Innorix Flaws and ThreatNeedle Malware
summary:
At least six organizations in South Korea have been targeted by the prolific North Korea-linked Lazarus Group as part of a campaign dubbed Operation SyncHole.
The activity targeted South Korea's software, IT, financial, semiconductor manufacturing, and telecommunications industries, according to a r

title: Microsoft fixes bug causing incorrect 0x80070643 WinRE errors
summary: Microsoft says it resolved a known issue causing erroneous 0x80070643 installation failure errors when deploying the April 2025 Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) updates. [...]

title: Linux io_uring PoC Rootkit Bypasses System Call-Based Threat Detection Tools
summary:
Cybersecurity researchers have demonstrated a proof-of-concept (PoC) rootkit dubbed Curing that leverages a Linux asynchronous I/O mechanism called io_uring to bypass traditional system call monitoring.
This causes a "major blind spot in Linux runtime security tools," ARMO said.

title: 159 CVEs Exploited in Q1 2025 — 28.3% Within 24 Hours of Disclosure
summary:
As many as 159 CVE identifiers have been flagged as exploited in the wild in the first quarter of 2025, up from 151 in Q4 2024.

title: Linux 'io_uring' security blindspot allows stealthy rootkit attacks
summary: A significant security gap in Linux runtime security caused by the 'io_uring' interface allows rootkits to operate undetected on systems while bypassing advanced Enterprise security software. [...]

title: Darcula Adds GenAI to Phishing Toolkit, Lowering the Barrier for Cybercriminals
summary:
